One block at time. The player never will be able to destroy or place more than one block at time without commands.

I think any new armor should be an upgrade from diamond and have more enchanting features, so instead of "this is the objectively strongest tier that I have to have", you'll have to make a choice in upgrading stuff.
that would be to many items and will lose the point that a crafting table simple
No, but maybe soul fire could increase the speed the duration runs out (along with a special particle effect and maybe sound effect so you know about it).

I can actually see more types of blocks that would be better with pillars such as; Diorite, Granite, regular stone, smooth stone, and andesite. Basically, since we have the Stonecutter now, those said blocks would be awesome to have unique carvings similar to both regular and red sandstone.
This would be amazing!!!!
Yes, and its texture should be similar to what is found in Minecraft Dungeons.
those are great ideas but i dont think it would be added as it is similar to the fire aspect and fire resistance enchantments.
I'm not just gonna give the vote to you, give me proof of concept and then I'll consider.
reminds me of breath of the wild, I like it!
This is nice, it will change how you think about armor.  Like what to wear during what, it will add some purpose to the weaker types of armour.
If they add copper armor, thunderstorms would be mayhem lol. that would be minigame material! nice suggestion!

Different colors of natural sand would be nice.  We already have two in the game.

However, with Concrete Powder having the same texture ... then black sand will just look like black concrete powder.

Came here to suggest black sand.  White sand would be nice too.

 

Problem with using concrete powder as sand is that you can't place it next to water because it will turn to solid concrete.
In reality, how would they be different than a splash potion of poison or dumping a lava bucket on your enemy?
What an awful idea, it smacks of chemical warfare, which is not something Mojang could ever want in their game.
Use mods if you want it that badly
These may be better suggestions for a HighSchool/College Level edition of Minecraft: Education.
Way to modern.  Just use potions.
what about new potions that when used, your sword can temporarily apply effects te your enemies. it would be like enchantments but temporary and changeable.

Yes. I get that it's supposed to be kid-friendly and school appropriate but it would be a better teacher if you learn the dangerous stuff chemistry makes as well as the safer stuff. I mean, they let you make Uranium-235 ffs (that's the kind of uranium they put in nuclear reactors and atomic bombs).
It will be fun

My suggestions (using oak tree as example), the following are stages of growth

  1. sapling
  2. small tree with thin trunk, made of new block that is a fence with bark texture
  3. original small tree with no branches (about 5-7 block trunk)
  4. original tall tree with no branches (about 8-10 block trunk)
  5. original big tree with branches
  6. OPTIONAL huge tree with 2x2 trunk and many branches
I was looking for it

Mc Rat: Not sure if water is necessary for obsidian or just one possible route to get it... but I was mainly thinking of how you can find obsidian in nether fortress chests. How does it get there? Obsidian veins is one answer.

 

I suppose, though, that nether invaders are stealing it from the overworld. Although that leaves open the question "how did nether invaders build a portal to the overworld?"
In my opinion all blocks should do this, with the amount dependent on something like blast resistance (so stone would dampen more than dirt).
Yes! Redstone stuff can get really loud.
I think this really needs to be looked at, pistons are so loud trying to make interesting builds with redstone can get annoying
Lots of farm animals can get annoying real quick hehe

I have to take off my headphones whenever I'm checking on my RS controller (1.16
1) because I have a milkmaid rat stuck in a tiny pen with a cow and a fluid interface, if there is a mod that makes power based on annoyance amount that could power an entire world of mine...

 

Edit: replace rat cage with headphones
This would improve minecraft so much!!!!!!!!! In combination with the skulk sensor, this would be so cool. We need it!

In some way, Mojang is already doing something similar to this with how wool blocks prevent sounds from reaching Sculk Sensors. With that in mind, it would make sense to extend this and make wool blocks audibly dampen sounds from the player's perspective. Maybe Mojang is already planning to do that in 1.17; but if not, they definitely should... as long as it can be done without performance issues.

I don't think this will ever happen because in Mojang's eyes it would "take away from creativity." It would be cool. But I also think the idea needs some nerfing or repurposing, such as, only sorting non-stackable items, only having one exit, or not sorting items but funnelling items faster like hopper Minecarts. Good idea overall just needs some re-thinking.

Another idea for the recipe is to include a redstone comparator. It could use the comparator instead of the chest and copper instead of iron. Since there is no chest it would have no storage (just holds two items: the goal and the item being compared) . It would pull in one item at a time and then push it out.
These could be easily chained side by side to sort multiple different items into different chests with a catch all chest on the side of the last one.

I feel like this post is poorly worded so I'll put my "wants" for auto crafting in a more structured way as a comment.

1. Give the crafting table an inventory so items can stay in it when you don't have it open.

2. Let hoppers be able to push items into and take items out of the crafting table. (prioritize pulling recipe over items, Can only push into empty slots)

3. Let comparators interact with crafting tables where there is one signal strength for each slot filled.

 

This would be enough to let us use redstone to automate crafting.
Excellent idea! Perhaps for added practicality, you could craft the Cattails themselves into rope, which could be climbable and crafted into rope ladders?
I think cattail could be dried and crafted into baskets
I wouldn't mind if they were just decorative.

Many Parts of the Cattail are also edible, so this could be a possible food source that could be scavenged. 

Maybe they could also function like candles, where they can multiply within one block, and harvesting takes one at a time. If you take them all they're gone, but if you leave a few they'll grow back.
Cattail is a great choice for the mangrove biome the mud kinda looks like a gray color they should fix it
The same value as diamond seems a bit op since copper is pretty common but I like the idea of the oxidized tools. It also would be nice if oxidized swords applied a bit of poison damage

I 100% support this. Nether Stars are already immune to explosions, so it makes sense to have them be protected from flame, too.
